info.title: Moku REST Service
info.description: Configure moku with simple REST calls

get.description: Get name of the Moku
Get serial of the Moku
Summary of the current state
Describes the moku. Returns name, hardware model, firmware version
Get the last calibration date
Get current firmware version of the Moku
Get all available power supplies on the Moku hardware

post.description: Read Power supply of a specific ID
Configure a specific power supply channel (Once a load is connected, the power supply operates either at the set current or set voltage, whichever reaches the set point first)

get.description: Check if hardware is using an external reference clock

post.description: Enable/Disable external 10MHz external clock

get.description: Returns a short summary of current instrument state

post.description: Set a register value
Gets the value for a given register index
Configures the output waveform.
[[Deprecated]] Configures the load on output waveform.
[[Deprecated]] Get the load on output waveform.
Configures the output termination on given channel.
Get the output termination on given channel.
Set the Waveform Generator to sane defaults.
Get the frontend settings
Set up modulation on an output channel.
Disable modulation on an output channel.
Configures burst modulation on a given channel
Configures sweep modulation on a given channel

get.description: Synchronize the phase of both output channels. The phase of both channels is reset to their respective phase offset values
Returns a short summary of current instrument state

post.description: Set a register value
Gets the value for a given register index
Set the Spectrum Analyzer to sane defaults.
Configures the input impedance, coupling, and range for each channel.
Returns the input impedance, coupling, and range for requested channel
Generate a waveform on the output channels.

get.description: Returns the current resolution bandwidth (Hz)

post.description: Set desired Resolution Bandwidth. Actual resolution bandwidth will be rounded to the nearest allowable unit when settings are applied to the device.

get.description: Returns the current frequency span

post.description: Set the desired frequency span to be analyzed. Rounding and quantization in the instrument limits the range of spans for which a full set of 1024 data points can be calculated. This means that the resultant number of data points in SpectrumData frames will vary with the set span. Note however that the associated frequencies are given with the frame containing the data.
Sets up commonly used configurations in the Spectrum Analyzer, including the frequency range, channel signal source, resolution bandwidth, and window function.
Set Window function

get.description: Returns the current window function

post.description: Turn waveform generator output off
Configures the output termination on given channel.
Get the output termination on given channel.
Get the latest sweep results

get.description: Returns a short summary of current instrument state

post.description: Set a register value
Gets the value for a given register index
Reset the Frequency Response Analyzer to default state.
Configures the input impedance, coupling, and range for each input channel.
Get the input impedance, coupling, and range for each input channel.
Sets up commonly used configurations in the Frequency Response Analyzer, including the frequency range, averaging, and swept sine amplitude.
Toggle measurement between Input and Input/Output
Set the output sweep parameters

get.description: Get the output sweep parameters

post.description: Start sweeping
Stop sweeping
Configures the output sweep amplitude and offset. Ensure the input signal passing through the device under test will not exceed the input range as configured by set_frontend
Get the output sweep amplitude and offset. Ensure the input signal passing through the device under test will not exceed the input range as configured by set_frontend

[[Deprecated]] Get the current output load for a given channel

Set output phase
set the harmonic multiplier to demodulate at integer harmonic of output

post.description: Get current sweep data

get.description: Resets the phase accumulator of both output waveforms

post.description: Configures the output waveform for each channel
[[Deprecated]] Configures the load on output waveform.
[[Deprecated]] Get the load on output waveform.
Configures the termination on output channel.
Get the termination on output channel.
Disable the modulation of a channel

Configures pulse modulation mode of a channel. The Arbitrary Waveform Generator has the ability to insert a dead time between cycles of the look-up table. This time is specified in cycles of the waveform. During this time, the output will be held at the given dead_voltage. This allows the user to, for example, generate infrequent pulses without using space in the LUT to specify the time between, keeping the full LUT size to provide a high-resolution pulse shape.
Configures the burst modulation mode of a channel
Reset the Oscilloscope to default state
Synchronize the phase of both output channels.
Configures the input impedance, coupling, and range for each channel
Get the input impedance, coupling, and range for each channel
Configures the signal source for multiple channels. Request should be a list of sources where each item is a channel, source key value pair
Configures the signal source of each channel
Configures input attenuation

post.description: Configures the interpolation

Sets up commonly used configurations in the Oscilloscope, including the time base, channel signal source, and trigger.

Configures the input impedance, coupling, and range for each channel.
Get the input impedance, coupling, and range for each input channel.

Changes acquisition mode between 'Normal' and 'Precision'. Precision mode is also known as decimation, it samples at the full rate and averages excess data points to improve precision. Normal mode works by direct down sampling, throwing away extra data points.

Enable the specified input channel
Synchronize the phase of both output channels.

Start the data logging session to file. The Moku’s internal file system is volatile and will be wiped when the Moku is turned off. If you want your data logs to persist  move them to a permanent storage location before powering your Moku off.

Configures the specified monitor channel to view the desired PID instrument signal. There are two monitoring channels available, each of these can be assigned to source signals from any of the internal PID instrument monitoring points. Signals larger than 12-bits must be either truncated or clipped to the allowed size.
